Name: Apple___Apple_scab
Cure: Foliar applications of PHOSPHO-jet are made at pre bloom (bud swell or silver tip stage) and every 7 days until end of bloom period. Foliar applications of Propizol in crabapple trees may likewise be applied every 21 days from bud swell or silver tip stage. Alternatively, apply Propizol by trunk injection. Make applications when the trees are in full leaf and actively growing for control of the next season’s leaf disease development

Name: Apple___Black_rot
Cure: Remove the cankers by pruning at least 15 inches below the end and burn

Name: Apple___Cedar_apple_rust
Cure: The fungicide myclobutanil (Immunox) is available to homeowners and is effective in controlling apple scab and cedar apple rust

Name: Cherry___Powdery_mildew
Cure: Spray on plants every one to two weeks. Potassium bicarbonate– Similar to baking soda

Name: Corn___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray_leaf_spot
Cure: foliar fungicides can be used to manage gray leaf spot outbreaks

Name: Corn___Common_rust
Cure: If the corn begins to show symptoms of infection, immediately spray with a fungicide

Name: Corn___Northern_Leaf_Blight
Cure: Always treat pruning and cutting tools with a 1:10 bleach solution after each use. Rake and remove all debris from around your plants before the leaves bud each spring

Name: Grape___Black_rot
Cure: Mancozeb, and Ziram are all highly effective against black rot. Because these fungicides are strictly protectants, they must be applied before the fungus infects or enters the plan

Name: Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles)
Cure: Lime sulfur sprays can manage the trio of pathogens that cause black measles

Name: Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spot)
Cure: Spraying of the grapevines at 3-4 leaf stage with fungicides like Bordeaux mixture @ 0.8% or Copper Oxychloride @ 0.25% or Carbendazim @ 0.1% are effective against this disease.

Name: Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening)
Cure: antibacterial management, sanitation, removal of infected plants, frequent scouting, and most importantly, crisis declaration

Name: Peach___Bacterial_spot
Cure: A plant with bacterial spot cannot be cured. Remove symptomatic plants from the field or greenhouse to prevent the spread of bacteria to healthy plants

Name: Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot
Cure: Bacterial viruses (bacteriophages) that specifically kill the bacteria are available.  Submerge seeds for one minute in 1.3% sodium hypochlorite or in hot water (50°C) for 25 minutes

Name: Potato___Early_blight
Cure: It is a Soil Borne disease. Therefore, rotation and field sanitation of crops are effective in preventing disease
